result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter J. Samuelson was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs of $1,744 (less $950 bond) + $46.50 blood draw fee due on or before 9-1-22.  In default of payment, State Debt Collections.
Report forthwith with Good Time and Huber granted.  May have furlough for scheduled doctor appointments.
Installed on any owned, operated or registered vehicle.
Follow through with all recommendations and appointments.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter J. Samuelson

defendant.name: Samuelson, Peter J.
defendant.address: 3669 Rocky Ledge Road, Little Suamico, WI 54141

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Peter J. Samuelson in court.  Attorney Christine Bruen in court for Peter J. Samuelson. Complaint reviewed. Plea negotiations reviewed. NC plea entered on 2.  Plea and waiver questionnaire reviewed.  Plea made freely and voluntary. Admitted to two prior OWI's.   Court finds deft. guilty and orders JOC entered into the record.  Count 1 and 3 dismissed.  State makes recommendation according to OWI guidelines.  Defense makes recommendation.  Deft. makes statement.  Sentence:  Court orders fine and costs of $1,744 (less $950 bond) + $46.50 blood draw fee due on or before 9-1-22.  In default of payment, State Debt Collections.  60 days jail report forthwith with Good Time and Huber granted, 7 days credit. May have furloughs for scheduled doctor appointments.  Alcohol assessment and follow through; 6 points assessed to DL; DL revoked for 24 months; IID installed on any owned, operated or registered vehicle for 12 months.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan
